cards.title: Business context
cards.text-copy: Gain understanding of the business goals and priorities through stakeholder interviews and analysis

cards.title: Competitor analysis
cards.text-copy: Learn from how others have solved similar problems. Compare successful/unsucessful solutions

cards.title: Benchmark studies
cards.text-copy: Compare desired outcomes and features against industry standards

cards.title: Data analysis
cards.text-copy: See if you can find any useful data. Page views, clicks etc. Include big data, CRM systems or any existing data

cards.title: User journey maps (now)
cards.text-copy: Understand how users use the existing system by mapping out the user flows and pathways

cards.title: Content analysis
cards.text-copy: Understand existing content, affinities, and taxonomies,  e.g. via card sorting

cards.title: User feedback
cards.text-copy: Analyse existing user feedback, talk to customer service, look at reviews and ratings

cards.title: Emphathy map
cards.text-copy: Get stakeholders on the same page on who you are building the software forUnderstand existing content, affinities, and taxonomies,  e.g. via card sorting

cards.title: Context of use
cards.text-copy: Understand where, when and how users perform their tasks. Why are they performing their tasks? What are their goals? Do interviews, surveys, focus groups, or contextual inquiries

cards.title: Personas
cards.text-copy: Archetypal/proto personas - Descriptions of the user groups, subsequently developed into full personas. Variations: Proto personas, lean personas, MVP personas

cards.title: Service safari
cards.text-copy: Go through the user's journey yourself, immerse yourself in the experience and take notes

cards.title: Red routes
cards.text-copy: Identify key routes, what most users do often (or first), and prioritise these

cards.title: User experience maps
cards.text-copy: Understand individual's interactions and relationship with an organisation over time and across different channels

cards.title: Story mapping
cards.text-copy: Map out the steps and tasks that various users need to go through to achieve their goals. Define scope, plan and prioritise

cards.title: User stories
cards.text-copy: Write actionable user stories: As a [...], I want to [â€¦], so that I can [...]. Remember to have personas in mind when writing user stories
